sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Limited (NYSE:SGHC) most popular amongst private companies who own 45% of the shares, institutions hold 36%
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited shows significant ownership by private companies, controlling 45% of its shares, indicating their substantial influence on management and strategy. Institutions hold 36% of the company, suggesting professional investor confidence, though caution is advised as even institutions can make poor investments. The two largest shareholders collectively own over half the company, giving them considerable power over its decisions.

feed.title: Investors Heavily Search Super Group (SGHC) Limited (SGHC): Here is What You Need to Know
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited has become a highly searched stock on Zacks.com, prompting an examination of the factors influencing its performance. The company's shares returned -11.6% in the past month, while the Zacks S&P 500 composite saw a +0.9% change, and the Zacks Gaming industry lost 1%. This article delves into Super Group's earnings estimates, revenue growth, and valuation to provide insights for investors.

feed.title: Assessing Super Group (NYSE:SGHC)’s Valuation After Its New 4¢ Dividend Boost for 2025
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) announced a 4¢ per share cash dividend, bringing 2025 payouts to 16¢ per share, signaling management's confidence in its cash generation. Despite recent share price fluctuations, the stock has shown strong long-term performance and is considered by Simply Wall St to be 36.7% undervalued with a fair value of $17.75 versus its closing price of $11.23. The company's accelerated investment in technology and AI initiatives is expected to enhance product offerings, automate processes, and drive efficiencies.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Limited (NYSE:SGHC) to Issue Quarterly Dividend of $0.04
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited announced a quarterly dividend of $0.04 per share, payable on December 19th to stockholders of record on December 15th, representing an annualized dividend of $0.16 and a dividend yield of 1.4%. The company a dividend payout ratio of 23.2% and analysts expect it to cover future payouts, with a projected EPS of $0.49 next year. SGHC recently beat Q3 earnings expectations with EPS of $0.19 and revenue of $557 million, and shares currently trade near $11.11 with a market cap of around $5.59 billion.

feed.title: How Investors Are Reacting To Super Group (SGHC) (SGHC) Boosting 2025 Dividend Payout To US$0.16
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) announced a US$0.04 per-share dividend, bringing its total 2025 payout to US$0.16, reflecting strong cash generation and strategic capital allocation. This dividend, supported by consistent revenue and cash flow growth and regional initiatives, is converting operational success into direct shareholder returns. The company's investment narrative focuses on its ex-U.S. online betting and gaming footprint, with a projected 59% upside to its current price based on revenue and earnings forecasts through 2028.

feed.title: Russell Investments Group Ltd. Acquires 458,273 Shares of Super Group (SGHC) Limited $SGHC
feed.summary: Russell Investments Group Ltd. significantly increased its stake in Super Group (SGHC) Limited, acquiring an additional 458,273 shares during the second quarter, bringing its total holdings to 620,512 shares valued at approximately $6.81 million. The company recently reported strong earnings, beating analyst estimates, and announced a quarterly dividend. Analyst ratings for Super Group remain largely positive, with several firms upgrading their price targets.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Limited $SGHC Shares Acquired by Geode Capital Management LLC
feed.summary: Geode Capital Management LLC has increased its stake in Super Group (SGHC) Limited by 7.9%, now owning 1,888,540 shares valued at approximately $20.7 million. Several analysts have recently raised their price targets and ratings for SGHC, with a consensus "Buy" rating and an average price target of $16.30. Super Group recently surpassed earnings expectations, reporting EPS of $0.19 against an estimated $0.14, and revenue of $557 million against an estimated $436 million.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Falls Hard as UK Govt Slaps Higher Gambling Duties
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited saw its share price drop by 6.74% after the UK government announced higher duties on gambling activities, effective April 2026. The new rules will increase taxes on remote gaming to 40% and online sports betting to 25%, negatively impacting Super Group's 2026 adjusted EBITDA by 6%. Despite this, the company expressed support for the regulations and has prepared mitigation measures.

feed.title: Super Group (NYSE: SGHC) notes UK gambling taxes rising to 40% iGaming, 25% betting
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) announced that the UK government's new Autumn Statement will increase Remote Gaming Duty (iGaming) to 40% by April 2026 and General Betting Duty (Online Sports Betting) to 25% by April 2027. While the company supports reasonable taxation and urges strict enforcement against offshore operators, it estimates these tax hikes will impact its 2026 Group Adjusted EBITDA by approximately 6%. Super Group plans to implement mitigation levers to offset this impact, affirming its commitment to sustainable growth and capital allocation without altering its long-term trajectory.

feed.title: Boston Partners Has $2.94 Million Position in Super Group (SGHC) Limited $SGHC
feed.summary: Boston Partners reduced its stake in Super Group (SGHC) by 10.3% in the second quarter, now holding 267,607 shares valued at $2.94 million. Despite the reduction, Super Group surpassed earnings expectations with an EPS of $0.19 and revenue of $557 million. Analysts maintain a "Buy" rating for SGHC, with a consensus target price of $16.30, while the stock trades around $10.93.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Limited (SGHC) Raises Revenue and EBITDA Guidance Asserting Underlying Growth
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited has reported strong financial results, with a 65% increase in adjusted EBITDA to $152 million and revenue up 26% to $556.9 million. The company also saw an 18% increase in monthly active customers. Following these results, SGHC has raised its revenue guidance to between $2.17 and $2.27 billion and adjusted EBITDA guidance to between $555 and $565 million.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Falls Hard as UK Govt Slaps Higher Gambling Duties
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited experienced a significant stock drop after the UK government announced higher duties on gambling activities. These new regulations will increase taxes on remote gaming and online sports betting, impacting Super Group's adjusted EBITDA by 6% in 2026. Despite the financial hit, the company expressed support for the rules, emphasizing the importance of robust enforcement against offshore operators to protect the regulated sector.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Limited (SGHC) Surpasses Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited reported Q3 earnings of $0.19 per share, exceeding the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $0.14 and significantly higher than $0.09 a year ago. The company also surpassed revenue estimates, posting $557 million for the quarter, largely due to strong performance in the gaming industry. With a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy), the stock is anticipated to continue outperforming the market.

feed.title: S&P 500 Futures Decline in Premarket Trading; Super Group (SGHC), Life Time Group Holdings Lead
feed.summary: S&P 500 futures showed a decline in premarket trading. Despite this, Super Group (SGHC) Ltd. and Life Time Group Holdings Inc. (LTH) were notable gainers, rising by 13.8% and 11.7% respectively before the U.S. stock market opened.

feed.title: Super Group (NYSE: SGHC) to join Oppenheimer, Deutsche Bank, Craig-Hallum investor events
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC), parent company of Betway and Spin, announced that its management will participate in several upcoming investor conferences and events. These events include non-deal roadshows with Oppenheimer, Craig-Hallum, and Macquarie, as well as conferences hosted by Deutsche Bank, Needham, BTIG, and ICR, providing opportunities for investors to meet with company executives.

feed.title: Super Group (NYSE: SGHC) raises FY revenue guidance to $2.17–$2.27B after strong Q3 results
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) reported robust Q3 2025 financial results, with revenue increasing by 26% to $556.9 million and Adjusted EBITDA up 65% year-over-year to $152.1 million. This strong performance led the company to raise its full-year revenue guidance to between $2.17 - $2.27 billion and Adjusted EBITDA to between $555 - $565 million. The growth was primarily driven by strong performances in Africa, Europe, and North America, along with an 18% increase in Monthly Active Customers.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Soars 15.6% on Q3 Earnings, Higher Growth Outlook
feed.summary: Super Group SGHC Ltd. (NYSE:SGHC) saw its stock jump 15.62% after reporting stellar Q3 earnings, with net income surging 860% to $96 million and revenues increasing by 25.7% to $557 million. The company also raised its full-year 2025 revenue and adjusted EBITDA outlook. This strong performance follows an eight-day losing streak, delighting investors.

feed.title: Q3 Results: Super Group to Report on Nov 3 After Close with Webcast and Investor Presentation
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited will announce its third-quarter 2025 financial results on November 3, 2025, after the U.S. stock market closes. This will be followed by a conference call and webcast on November 4, 2025, at 7:45 a.m. ET to discuss these results, which will also be accompanied by a supplemental investor presentation.

feed.title: Here is What to Know Beyond Why Super Group (SGHC) Limited (SGHC) is a Trending Stock - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: This article analyzes why Super Group (SGHC) Limited (SGHC) is a trending stock, focusing on its earnings estimate revisions, projected revenue growth, and past performance against estimates. It highlights a positive outlook for the company based on increasing earnings estimates and a strong Zacks Rank. The analysis also touches on the stock's valuation.

feed.title: A Fresh Look at Super Group (NYSE:SGHC)'s Valuation After Its Recent Share Price Pause - simplywall.st
feed.summary: Super Group (NYSE:SGHC) has seen a slight share price dip recently, despite a 237% total shareholder return over the past year. While one narrative suggests the stock is 26% undervalued with a fair value of $17.63 due to strategic pivots and profitability forecasts, another view highlights its high P/E ratio of 45.5x compared to peers and the industry average, suggesting it might be overvalued by market ratios.

feed.title: Is Super Group's Stock Rally Justified Amid Strong 2025 Forecasts? - Yahoo
feed.summary: This article analyzes Super Group's (SGHC) stock performance and valuation amidst strong 2025 forecasts. It explores two valuation approaches: Discounted Cash Flow (DCF), which suggests the stock is undervalued, and Price vs. Earnings (PE), which indicates it is overvalued compared to its fair ratio. The piece concludes by introducing "Narratives" as a personalized valuation tool for investors.

feed.title: Is Super Group's Stock Rally Justified Amid Strong 2025 Forecasts? - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: This article examines whether Super Group's (SGHC) recent stock rally, driven by significant gains of 237.0% over the past year and 107.3% since early 2024, is justified by its fundamentals. It analyzes the company through a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) model and a Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio comparison, finding it undervalued by DCF but overvalued by its PE ratio compared to a proprietary "Fair Ratio." The piece concludes by introducing the concept of "Narratives" for investors to develop personalized valuations based on their assumptions about the company's future.

The company's stock has already performed strongly, gaining 6.5% over the past four weeks.

This optimism is reflected in a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) and recent stock price gains of 6.5% over the past four weeks, suggesting potential for further upside.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Hits New 52-Week High of USD 14.38 - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) reached a new 52-week high of USD 14.38 on October 6, 2025, marking a 301.17% increase over the past year. The company, a small-cap player in the leisure services industry with a market capitalization of USD 6,343 million, has shown strong financial health with a P/E ratio of 26.00 and a return on equity of 30.19%. This performance significantly outpaced the S&P 500's growth and highlights its robust market position despite a 0.00% dividend yield.

feed.title: Super Group to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited announced its participation in several upcoming investor conferences in August and September 2025. Key executives, including CEO Neal Menashe and CFO Alinda Van Wyk, will attend events such as the Oppenheimer, Canaccord Genuity, Citizens Capital Markets & Advisory, Benchmark, and Citi Global TMT Conferences. The company, parent to Betway and Spin, aims to engage with investors and provide business updates.

feed.title: Super Group (SGHC) Limited Beat Analyst Estimates: See What The Consensus Is Forecasting For This Year
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited exceeded analyst expectations in its latest quarterly results, with revenues of US$459m and statutory earnings per share (EPS) of US$0.11, both beating forecasts. Analysts have since increased their revenue and EPS estimates for 2025 to US$2.17 billion and US$0.65 respectively, and raised the price target to US$11.20, indicating increased optimism for the company's future growth. The company is now expected to grow faster than the wider industry.

feed.title: Super Group Issues Business Update as 2024 Closes
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) Limited has raised its full-year 2024 total revenue guidance to €1.6 billion and ex-US Adjusted EBITDA guidance to greater than €360 million following strong performance. The company also declared a special cash dividend of 15¢ per share for Q4 2024, bringing the total 2024 dividend to 25¢ per share, and plans to begin regular quarterly dividends in 2025. CEO Neal Menashe expressed pride in the year's performance and the ability to return excess cash to shareholders.

feed.title: Super Group president steps down after more than a decade
feed.summary: Richard Hasson, president and chief commercial officer of Super Group, has resigned after 12 years with the company, though his exact departure date is pending to ensure a smooth transition. Hasson joined as commercial director for Win Technologies in 2012, rising to president and chief operating officer in 2020, and then president and chief commercial officer in March 2024. Super Group clarified that his resignation is not due to any disagreement, and shares in SGHC Ltd. (NYSE:SGHC) closed 4.75 per cent lower on the day of the announcement.

feed.title: Super Group confirms Richard Hasson to resign as CCO & President
feed.summary: Super Group (SGHC) announced that Richard Hasson will resign as President and Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) in the first half of 2025 to ensure a smooth transition. Hasson has served the company for thirteen years, guiding its transformation from Win Technologies to Betway Group and eventually to the NYSE-listed Super Group. The company maintains its 2024 full-year guidance and plans to discuss a special dividend for shareholders.

feed.title: Online Gambling Market to Grow by USD 181.47 Billion (2024-2028), Fueled by Digital Tech Adoption, with AI Driving Market Transformation - Technavio
feed.summary: The global online gambling market is projected to grow by USD 181.47 billion from 2024 to 2028, driven by the increasing adoption of digital technologies and the emergence of innovative features like live betting, VR, and AR. Technavio reports a CAGR of over 11.96% during this period, with AI transforming the market. Despite this growth, challenges such as online data security issues and a lack of transparency in dispute resolution systems pose significant concerns for the industry.

feed.title: Betway named Manchester City’s official global betting partner
feed.summary: Super Group's Betway brand has become the official global betting partner of English Premier League champions Manchester City in a multi-year agreement. This partnership expands Betway's sports sponsorship portfolio and will involve various activations, exclusive content, and training on betting integrity and responsible gambling. Shares in Betway owner Super Group Ltd saw a slight increase following the announcement.

feed.title: Games Global accelerates US market entry with DGC acquisition
feed.summary: Games Global is set to enter the US market after acquiring the B2B assets of Digital Gaming Corporation (DGC) from Super Group. This acquisition, pending regulatory approvals, will allow Games Global to directly offer content from 40 exclusive studios and over 1,300 proprietary games to US operators. Super Group's CEO noted that the sale allows them to focus on B2C growth, while Games Global aims to strengthen its global position and innovate in the fast-growing US market.

feed.title: Super Group completes Digital Gaming Corporation acquisition
feed.summary: Super Group has finalized its acquisition of Digital Gaming Corporation (DGC), significantly expanding its presence into the US market. This acquisition gives Super Group market access in up to twelve US states, with DGC currently live in eight states utilizing the Betway brand. Super Group aims to leverage its successful business model in the US and expects DGC to launch in Louisiana in Q1 2023, further growing its global footprint.

feed.title: Betway fined for marketing on children’s websites
feed.summary: Super Group’s Betway brand has been fined £0.4m by the Gambling Commission for inadvertently displaying its logo on a website popular with children. The breach occurred between April 2020 and November 2021 on West Ham United Football Club’s children's pages, failing to comply with socially responsible marketing obligations and advertising codes. The Commission emphasized the seriousness of breaches related to child protection, despite no evidence children gambled.

feed.title: Betway signs first football sponsorship deals in Chile
feed.summary: Betway, the sports betting operator owned by Super Group, has secured its initial sponsorship agreements in Chile, partnering with five football clubs in the Chilean First Division. These two-year deals will provide extensive brand visibility for Betway through branding on team kits, stadium perimeter boards, and press conference backdrops. Betway will also collaborate with the clubs to develop exclusive content and fan activations.

feed.title: SEAC completes $4.75bn merger with Super Group - M&A - iGB
feed.summary: Sports Entertainment Acquisition Corp. (SEAC) has finalized its $4.75 billion merger with Betway owner Super Group. The newly combined entity will trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "SGHC" starting January 28, 2022. This move is expected to strengthen Super Group's brand globally by expanding its customer base, entering new markets, and forming strategic partnerships.
